common_issues.title: Ollama Installation Failures in Pieces
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues installing and using Ollama within the Pieces desktop application across Linux and Windows.  Problems include installation failures, model loading errors, and dependency conflicts.  Solutions involve ensuring curl is available in sandboxed environments and addressing potential issues with Pieces OS installation or configuration.

related_issues.title: Ollama failed to install in pieces
related_issues.text:
Ollama failed to install in pieces
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have a deepseek-r1:32b model installed in my desktop with ollama, and then try to use pieces for using this model locally, like there's a option called On-device copilot right, when I try to click to install ollama it shows failed to install and remaining all models are blocked, can you please fix it 
## GitHub Issue Summary
**Title:** Image not loading properly in Ollama
**Author:** srisrihari
**Date:** 2025-01-30

**Key Points:**
* User reported an image not loading properly in Ollama.
* The image was attached to the issue as a screenshot.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.

**Problems Identified:**
* The image was not loading correctly in Ollama.
* This is a known issue that the Pieces team is actively working on.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* No specific solution was proposed in this conversation.
* The issue was closed as a duplicate of another issue where a solution is already being tracked. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The issue is closed.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a fix for the image loading issue.

**Additional Notes:**
* The bot provided some helpful resources related to Ollama and Pieces.
* The user was encouraged to check out the existing issues and documentation.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Error

**Key Points:**

* Issue: Ollama fails to install via Pieces snap on Ubuntu due to missing `curl` dependency in the sandboxed environment.
* Problem: Internal miscommunication about package confinement level.
* Impact: Both downloading and inference of local LLM models are affected.

**Solutions:**

* Add `curl` to the list of dependencies in the snap definition file.
* Modify Pieces package to allow using Ollama from within the sandbox.

**Current Status:**

* Fix is in progress and expected to be released soon.
* Local LLM model download and inference remain unavailable until the fix is implemented.

**Outcome:**

* Ollama installation will function correctly within the Pieces snap environment.
* Users will be able to download and use local LLM models.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues on Port 39300
common_issues.description: Multiple users report "Connection refused" or "Route not found" errors when accessing Pieces OS on port 39300.  This is often due to Pieces OS using a dynamic port range. Solutions include verifying the actual port in use (check `.port.txt` file) or contacting Pieces support for assistance.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Raju-git20 reported an issue with PiecesOS not working with port 39300.
* mark-at-pieces responded that PiecesOS uses a range of ports and has a port-finding algorithm.
* Raju-git20 provided screenshots of the error message and confirmed the correct port in the config file.
* Raju-git20 shared information about their project, which involves scraping LinkedIn positions and applying with AI.
* mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a call to discuss the issue and provide feedback.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was not working with the expected port 39300.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mark-at-pieces clarified that PiecesOS uses a range of ports and has a port-finding algorithm.
* mark-at-pieces offered to connect Raju-git20 with the right people at Pieces to assist with their development.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Raju-git20 and mark-at-pieces have scheduled a call to discuss the issue further.

**Additional Notes:**

* Raju-git20 is working on a project that utilizes LinkedIn scraping and AI for job applications.

### Software

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The problem "route not found" appears whenever I attempt to access the pieces os endpoint on port 39300.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4f8961a-afa1-401d-82b5-cc2ead804b9f)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User Raju-git20 reported an issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces support bot.
* Mark from Pieces reached out for more information about the user's POS version.
* Mark provided some helpful resources and related issues.
* Further discussion moved to a separate issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/597).

**Problems Identified:**

* Raju-git20 encountered an error related to port connectivity.
* The specific port number used by POS was unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark suggested checking the com.pieces.os/production/config/.port.txt file for the POS port number.
* Mark offered to connect Raju-git20 with the appropriate people at Pieces for further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The original issue was closed.
* Discussion continued on a related issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/597).
* It is unclear if the user's problem was ultimately resolved.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Usage and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage by PiecesOS, potentially linked to internet connectivity or database operations. Version 11.1.0 aims to mitigate this. Additionally, users experience repeated update prompts, particularly with the Microsoft Store version. Workarounds include restarting PiecesOS or updating through the store.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS High Memory and CPU Usage

**Key Points:**

* PiecesOS is a local server that runs on your machine and is required for all Pieces products.
* Users have been experiencing high memory and CPU usage, even when not actively using Pieces.
* The issue is believed to be caused by heavy database technologies used by PiecesOS.

**Problems Identified:**

* High memory usage, even when not actively using Pieces.
* Spikes in CPU usage, causing slowdowns.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Replacing heavy database technologies with lighter ones in version 11.1.0.
* Working on additional fixes to improve performance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Version 11.1.0 is being released to address the issue. 
* Users are encouraged to update and report any improvements or remaining problems.

**Additional Notes:**

* Live context, which is a new feature, is known to contribute to higher resource usage.
* Disabling live context can help reduce resource usage.
* The Pieces team is actively working on further performance improvements.

related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies need help asap
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies need help asap
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50ccb8d9-4bd4-4036-85f9-6f42840bec67)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ceec7f4-768a-43cc-b06d-25a14c6d4e94)

I have this issue with opening Pieces and is checking updates and it does reload many times, need help asap
## Summary of GitHub Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @CPX10 reported an issue with Pieces software updates.
* The issue is related to installing Pieces/PiecesOS from the Microsoft Store.

**Problems Identified:**

* The software update prompt appears continuously when using Microsoft Store versions of Pieces and PiecesOS.
* Updating directly from the Microsoft Store does not resolve the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* To temporarily resolve the issue, the user can either:
    * **Quit PiecesOS and the Desktop App, then reopen them.**
    * **Update the applications from the Microsoft Store and then reopen them.**
* The Pieces team is working on improving the update experience for Microsoft Store users in the future.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been identified and workarounds have been provided to the user.
* The development team is working on a permanent solution to improve the update experience for Microsoft Store users.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation highlights the importance of clear error messages and intuitive update processes for users.
* The Pieces team is responsive to user feedback and actively working on improving the user experience.

common_issues.title: Pieces Startup and Update Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS launching and updating on Windows. These issues include non-dismissable overlay messages, repeated update prompts, and failures to launch. Suggested solutions involve checking startup configurations, updating through the Microsoft Store, and reinstalling the applications.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* ThemePark is experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop failing to launch on Windows 10.
* The issue seems to be related to both Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS trying to launch simultaneously on startup, creating a conflict.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Desktop fails to launch on startup.
* Potential timing conflict between PiecesOS and Desktop app during startup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Investigate if either PiecesOS or Desktop app is configured to launch on startup.
* Suggest switching the startup app to either PiecesOS or Desktop app to avoid conflict.
* Consider not running either app on startup.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* ThemePark has confirmed PiecesOS is set to launch on startup.
* Mack-at-pieces suggests switching to launching either PiecesOS or Desktop app on startup to resolve the conflict.
* ThemePark is open to suggestions and awaiting further guidance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is ongoing as of January 30, 2025.
* The specific solution to the problem has not yet been implemented.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS installation and functionality errors
common_issues.description: Users report issues with PiecesOS installation, launching, and Copilot integration. Problems include failure to launch, Copilot inaccessibility, and sandbox content visibility. Solutions involve reinstalling, waiting for stability updates, and seeking support for troubleshooting. Users also provide feedback on response time and accuracy compared to other AI tools.

related_issues.title: LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser
related_issues.text: LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.4 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Copilot's LTM is unable to see the content of a sandbox (eg. [Svelte Tutorial](https://svelte.dev/tutorial/kit/handlefetch)). ## Problem Identified: - Copilot not working in VSCode on PiecesOS 11.0.0 ## Key Points Raised: - User experiencing issues with Copilot after upgrading to PiecesOS 11.0.0 - User notified that a stability release is expected early next week (for PiecesOS 11.1.0) - User asked to confirm if the problem persists after updating to new version ## Solutions Proposed/Implemented: - Wait for the stability release (PiecesOS 11.1.0) scheduled for early next week ## Current Status/Outcome: - Issue resolution pending release of new version - User will report back after updating to PiecesOS 11.1.0 ## Additional notes: - Bot suggests related issues and helpful resources

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate resources to address the Ollama installation and functionality problems on both Windows and Linux. This includes investigating sandbox environments, dependency conflicts, and model loading errors.

**Investigate and Resolve Pieces OS Connectivity Issues:** Address the root cause of the "Connection refused" errors on port 39300.  Explore solutions like consistent port usage or providing clear instructions for users to find the dynamic port.

**Improve Pieces OS Resource Management:** Continue optimizing Pieces OS to reduce RAM/CPU usage, particularly in relation to internet connectivity and database operations. Monitor the effectiveness of version 11.1.0 in addressing this issue.

**Address Windows Startup and Update Issues:** Focus on resolving the problems with Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS launching and updating on Windows, including the non-dismissable overlay messages and repeated update prompts. Review startup configurations and update mechanisms.

**Enhance Communication on Dynamic Port Usage:** Clearly document and communicate that Pieces OS uses a dynamic port range. Provide instructions for users on how to identify the currently used port, such as checking the `.port.txt` file.

**Improve Error Messages and Troubleshooting:** Provide more informative error messages to users, particularly for issues like Ollama installation failures and Pieces OS connectivity problems. This will help users self-diagnose and potentially resolve issues without needing to contact support.

**Gather More Detailed User Data:** Collect additional information about user environments, Pieces OS versions, and specific error logs. This data will aid in faster identification and resolution of recurring issues.

**Consider a Dedicated Support Portal:** Explore creating a dedicated support portal with FAQs, troubleshooting guides, and a knowledge base. This can help users find solutions to common problems independently.
